w:r.w:t: You are invited to meet at 1pm
for an informal picnic at the Chester Green entrance.

feel safe to come together again
to check it’s still able to go ahead on the day
hat way if for some reason it can’t
as this is not an official Parkinson’s UK event. Everyone is therefore responsible for themselves. It is to be held in this public park, but we
actually be open on the day
The York Suite, Aston Court Hotel, Midland Road Derby DE1 2SL.
just an open meeting to renew old friendships

The wearing of masks is optional

w:r.w:t: "In October, I'm going to be taking on my first marathon to raise money for the Derby Branch of Parkinson’s UK. They've been such a great source of support and community to my wonderful Auntie and Uncle, since Brian was diagnosed 16 years ago. I'd be so grateful if you could spare a few pennies to help me say thank you
Good luck to Brian and Liz Greaves niece
we look forward to hearing how it goes
hat a generous gift, we are delighted
that they thought of giving it to support local people and families with Parkinson’s
As things return to normal, there will plenty of ways the Branch can make use of the money to benefit local people with the condition.
Remember all that voting and hassle finding a Chairperson? Thankfully
Rachel stepped in to help us,
need a vice chair, speaker finder
or know of someone recently retired or has reduced their working hours -
let us know at the meeting or ring or text
. In coming days, as things open up
Squad members were recently canvassed to
there is a demand for face-to-face
on 4 September. We’ll let you know next time.
I was interested to read a snippet in a magazine about a lady called Jo
nset Parkinson’s in 2015.She spent a lot of time walking on her local beach
helped her focus on the here and now
at a difficult stage in her life.
beach glass she finds to make jewellery
, donating half of her profits for charity.
Parkinson's UK are now encouraging the number below to be used
University of Derby and Burton NHS Specialist Rehabilitation Parkinson ‘s
London Road Community Hospital, London Road, Derby DE1 2QY 01332 258255
We are Parkinson’s UK. Powered by people. Funded by you. Improving life for everyone affected by Parkinson’s. Together we’ll find a cure.
Parkinson’s UK is the operating name of the Parkinson’s Disease Society of the United Kingdom. A charity registered in England and Wales (258197) and in Scotland (SC037554).
Contact Vicky via email for Zoom details:
led by Megan Smith Contact: info@movewithmegan.co.uk or
The World Parkinson Congress that was due to be held in Barcelona in June 2022, has now been re-arranged to July 2023 still in Barcelona. Several members attended a previous international congress
in Canada and found it a worthwhile experience
Perhaps a few from Derby may like to go again?

Katie Smith (Area Development Manager) is working with the Parkinson's UK Excellence Network and the University Hospitals of Derby & Burton NHS Foundation Trust team to organise this year's Derby Symposium. This will again be delivered online via Zoom and will take place on Monday 15 November 2021. This event is for
Professionals, people with Parkinson's, carers and family.
If you’ve never been to one of these events, why not give it a try?

After due consideration of the current rising coronavirus numbers, our fundraising event planned for September has been postponed. The event will go ahead at some point, so hang on to any items for the BIG raffle and MEGA tombola for the time being or pass onto Ann Pitt at any time.
the Prime Minister promised that he
'fix social care' in England. He still hasn't delivered on this promise while millions of people receiving and giving care are waiting for vital changes.
It's crucial that the Government makes sure that care services have the staff and funding they need, as a prio
We've joined with 50 other charities as a part of the Care Support Alliance to call on the Prime Minister to keep his promise. We want you to join us by writing to your MP to ask them to do the same.
To meet his promise the Prime Minister must invest in Council social care budgets.
e needs to grant staff working in care facilities a fair rate of pay along with the professional respect they deserve for their important work.

High quality care should be available whenever people need it and this investment in social care is long overdue. By writing to your MP you will be putting pressure on the Prime Minister to keep his promise and invest the time and money he needs into
